cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 mi (500 km) south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest tonight, turning north then north-northeast on Friday and accelerating toward the central Louisiana coast; the cone shows a track inland across Louisiana and into the lower Mississippi Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast between Cameron and Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, MS (T.S. Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the mouth of the Pearl River, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (T.S. Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from High Island, TX to Ocean Springs, MS; highest impacts near and east of Delta’s land-fall point across south-central and southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 30–45 mph with higher gusts) are expected Friday, with a low chance (<1 %) of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of inundation possible for areas from Port Fourchon to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, which includes Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts possible as Delta’s rain shield spreads across southeast Louisiana late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
